title: Understanding and Applying Inquiry Community Variables in Online Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning platform usage and understanding of elementary social studies curriculum
context.additional_context: In-service elementary teachers learn to understand the importance of inquiry community variables (teaching, social, and cognitive presence) in online flipped learning environments and apply them to actual lesson design. All activities consist of asynchronous content learning (videos, readings) using personal devices (BYOD) and real-time discussions/collaborations.

learning_goals: Learners can define and explain the three variables of a community of inquiry (teaching, social, and cognitive presence) in online flipped learning
Learners can suggest two or more strategies for learner interaction and collaborative problem-solving in a flipped learning environment
Learners can create an online social studies lesson design plan that reflects strategies to strengthen a community of inquiry
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
